book.title: The Hitch-hikers Guide to the Galaxy
book.author: Douglas Adams

book.title: The Restaurant at the end of the Universe
book.author: Douglas Adams

book.title: The Meaning of Liff
book.author: Douglas Adams
book.notes: For some reason the definition for Toronto has stayed with me for years, and still makes me smile whenever I use tomato ketchup.

book.title: So long, and thanks for all the fish
book.author: Douglas Adams

book.title: The Long Dark Tea-time of the Soul
book.author: Douglas Adams

book.title: The Salmon of Doubt
book.author: Douglas Adams
book.notes: The incomplete Dirk Gently is best not read, but Douglas' articles are excellent. His enthusiasm will be missed.

book.title: Dilbert Future
book.author: Scott Adams
book.notes: You've read it before but its still sadly accurate

book.title: The Queen of Air and Darkness
book.author: Poul Anderson

book.title: The Earth Book of Stormgate Vol III
book.author: Poul Anderson

book.title: The Earth Book of Stormgate Vol I
book.author: Poul Anderson

book.title: Tom Swift and his Sonic Boom Trap
book.author: Victor Appleton

book.title: The Left Hand of the Electron
book.author: Isaac Asimov

book.title: Time Untamed
book.author: Isaac Asimov
book.notes: Asimov actually wrote first story, no editor

book.title: Pride and Prejudice
book.author: Jane Austen
book.notes: Difficult to rate what is almost a reference book. Time has enhanced its historical insight but diluted its flow and pace.

book.title: Whatever Love Means
book.author: David Baddiel
book.notes: Took a long time to get going but tightened up as it went along

book.title: The Girls' Guide to Hunting and Fishing
book.author: Melissa Bank
book.notes: A quirky book for me to like but I loved its subtle shades

book.title: The Wasp Factory
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: Yes its all very good, but its not the only Banks book.

book.title: Consider Phlebas
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: The CultureI: Wow, very new wave chaos SciFi

book.title: The Player of Games
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: The Culture II: Somehow not as new wave, a bit more routine than I.

book.title: Use of Weapons
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: Culture III: A most macarbe horror SciFi book

book.title: The Crow Road
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: Funny, real and down to earth.

book.title: Complicity
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: One of his most thought provoking contemporary works

book.title: Against a Dark Background
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: I still like this strand, but not much new actually happens

book.title: Feersum Endjinn
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: Another bizzare one, and pretty good as well. Phonetic wording means it can be difficult to read

book.title: Whit
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: The seduction in the attic scene is very funny

book.title: Excession
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: More grand scale Culture, this still works pretty well.

book.title: A Song of Stone
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: Its somehow not quite bizzare or real enough to work

book.title: Inversions
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: Small scale SciFi seems to be a problem though. All the parts are very nice but it doesn't really add up.

book.title: The Business
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: Lare scale contemporary,t lively and fun. I liked this.

book.title: Dead Air
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: Lots of good parts, that don't quite fit.

book.title: The Algebraist
book.author: Iain Banks
book.notes: Its probably a bit too long but all in all great grand scale cultureish

book.title: Girlfriend 44
book.author: Mark Barrowcliffe
book.notes: Shocking. An ending that Holywood could never live with but the rest of the work all to often has to.

book.title: Luckey Dog
book.author: Mark Barrowcliffe
book.notes: I liked this book a lot more than I really like dogs

book.title: Time
book.author: Stephen Baxter
book.notes: Bough this because Patrick kept going on about the author. There is a good 200 pages here unfortunatly the book is longer

book.title: Blood Music
book.author: Greg Bear
book.notes: Brilliant start but tapers off a bit

book.title: Bored of the Rings
book.author: Henry N. Beard
book.notes: Parody on Lord of the Rings

book.title: Rain Men
book.author: Marcus Berkmann
book.notes: Cricket as it really is, sort of Fever Pitch for cricket

book.title: Kil'n People
book.author: David Brin
book.notes: A nice idea but we just take far too long getting anywhere, a plot would have helped

book.title: Angels and Demons
book.author: Dan Brown
book.notes: This is pretty much the same as the Da Vonci Code. I've a theory that the first Dan Brown anyone reads is the best and then its dimishing returns

book.title: The Da Vinci Code
book.author: Dan Brown
book.notes: American centric, information laden but pretty readable for all that. BTW: nobody in Europe calls roundabouts "a rotary"

book.title: The stone that never came down
book.author: John Brunner

book.title: Sex and the City
book.author: Candace Bushnell
book.notes: A bit relentless and depressing at times. Interesting slice and dice on life

book.title: 4 Blondes
book.author: Candace Bushnell
book.notes: Hard to rate as the first blonde was pretty good but the others rather declined

book.title: The Magicians' Guild
book.author: Trudi Canavan
book.notes: Black Magician 1: A bit slow to get going but has some interesting alternate viewpoints on the school for wizards genre

book.title: The Novice
book.author: Trudi Canavan
book.notes: Black Magician 2: The books start to get better as they go along. Enjoyable light read

book.title: The High Lord
book.author: Trudi Canavan
book.notes: Well worth persevering with, a well told story

book.title: The Daily Telegraph 14th Crossword Puzzle Book
book.author: Alan Cash

book.title: The New Avengers: House of Cards
book.author: Peter Cave

book.title: The Prince in Waiting Trilogy
book.author: John Christopher
book.notes: Beyond the Burning Lands, The Sword of the Spirits

book.title: The Lion Comarre and Against the Fall of Night
book.author: Arthur C. Clarke

book.title: The City and the Stars
book.author: Arthur C. Clarke
book.notes: Loger version of Against the Fall of Night

book.title: The Other Side of the Sky
book.author: Arthur C. Clarke

book.title: Report on Planet Three and other speculations
book.author: Arthur C. Clarke

book.title: The Best of Sci-Fi: 17 x Infinity
book.author: Groff Conklin

book.title: Tron
book.author: Brian Daley
book.notes: If only IO Ports looked like the did in Tron

book.title: Perry Rhodan 12: The Rebels of Tuglan
book.author: Clark Darlton

book.title: Doctor Who and the Tenth Planet
book.author: Gerry Davis

book.title: Private Eye's Bumper Book of Boobs
book.author: Andre Deutsch

book.title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep ?
book.author: Philip K Dick

book.title: Christmas Books
book.author: Charles Dickens
book.notes: Read the first story - whats not to like

book.title: Doctor Who and the Planet of the Daleks
book.author: Terrance Dicks

book.title: Pride and Promiscuity
book.author: Arielle Eckstut
book.notes: Made me smile, possibly because I had just read Miss Austen

book.title: The Elenium
book.author: David Eddings
book.notes: The Diamond Throne, The Ruby Knight and The Sapphire Rose

book.title: The Golden Wonder Book of Party Games
book.author: Joseph Edmundson

book.title: Is There Life in Outer Space
book.author: Peter Fairley

book.title: Cause Celeb
book.author: Helen Feilding
book.notes: I loved this book, better than Bridget because it was actually about something as well as being funny.

book.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
book.author: Helen Feilding
book.notes: Bridget is a looser, it makes it hard to feel any sympathy

book.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
book.author: Helen Feilding
book.notes: Bridget gets some backbone and the story plays much better

book.title: The MAD Book of Word Power
book.author: Albert B. Feldstein

book.title: Dirty Harry
book.author: Harry Julian Fink
book.notes: & Fink, Rita M. Written by Rock, Phillip

book.title: Magnum Force
book.author: Harry Julian Fink
book.notes: & Fink, Rita M. Written by Valley, Mel

book.title: Casino Royal
book.author: Ian Fleming
book.notes: Very interesting to see that this is now a book from a different age

book.title: Neverwhere
book.author: Neil Gaiman
book.notes: Don't be put of by the TV series the book is much better

book.title: Smoke and Mirrors
book.author: Neil Gaiman
book.notes: A little bit uneven but when its good its very good, including a great story hidden in the introduction

book.title: Stardust
book.author: Neil Gaiman
book.notes: A sort of farie tale - with attitude

book.title: American Gods
book.author: Neil Gaiman
book.notes: Sort of an American Neverwhere with Gods. Got a bit bogged down in the middle but a truly weird and great book

book.title: Anansi Boys
book.author: Neil Gaiman
book.notes: Well I thought American Gods was good but this is better, interesting predictable and yet not

book.title: Systemantics
book.author: John Gall
book.notes: How to win if you are Dilbert

book.title: My Legendary Girlfriend
book.author: Mike Gayle
book.notes: A bit twee, slow to start but hits his stride in the second half

book.title: Mr Commitment
book.author: Mike Gayle
book.notes: Too twee and too stereotypical to work properly, read Girlfriend 44 instead.

book.title: Pattern Recognition
book.author: William Gibson
book.notes: I carried this book all the way round the world, several times and in the end read it. Very accessible and very good, with the amout of jet lag in the book it is somehow apt

book.title: The Man Who Planted Trees
book.author: Jean Giono
book.notes: A present from Paul and Iona. A big smiley book.

book.title: Colony
book.author: Rob Grant
book.notes: A lot better than I thought it would be, clever and funny.

book.title: Effendi
book.author: Jon Courtenay Grimwood
book.notes: The Second Arabesk, I should get tired of these but they really are pretty well done

book.title: Felaheen
book.author: Jon Courtenay Grimwood
book.notes: The Third Arabesk, It is starting to pale by the third. Its a bit slow in the middle but worth pushing through

book.title: 9Tail Fox
book.author: Jon Courtenay Grimwood
book.notes: A bit less weir than the Arabesque and very very good

book.title: Replay
book.author: Ken Grimwood
book.notes: As recommended by Neale. A real surprise and a wonderfully individual book

book.title: Forever Free
book.author: Joe Haldeman
book.notes: Yet another disappointing sequel. I do not know if I am being harsh because the Forever War was so good.

book.title: Camouflage
book.author: Joe Haldeman
book.notes: Complete rounded and short, very good a bit like Replay

book.title: The Neutronium Alchemist
book.author: Peter F. Hamilton
book.notes: Night's Dawn 2, Loads of words,enjoyable words, but doesn't actually advance the story by much

book.title: A Second Chance at Eden
book.author: Peter F. Hamilton
book.notes: Reminiscent of State of the Art

book.title: The Naked God
book.author: Peter F. Hamilton
book.notes: Night's Dawn 3, best idea is to read the Reality Dysfunction and then ask someone to summarise

book.title: Fallen Dragon
book.author: Peter F. Hamilton
book.notes: A very well rounded and complete book, if not quite as kepowy as Reality Dysfunction.

book.title: The Stainless Steel Rat Saves the World
book.author: Harry Harrison

book.title: The Astounding Analog Reader Book TWo
book.author: Harry Harrison

book.title: Star Smashers of the Galaxy Rangers
book.author: Harry Harrison

book.title: The Stainless Steel Rat Wants You
book.author: Harry Harrison

book.title: The Stainless Steel Rat for President
book.author: Harry Harrison

book.title: A Stainless Steel Rat is Born
book.author: Harry Harrison

book.title: The Stainless Steel Rat Gets Drafted
book.author: Harry Harrison

book.title: Bill... on the planet of the Robot Slaves
book.author: Harry Harrison

book.title: The Stainless Steel Rat Sings The Blues
book.author: Harry Harrison

book.title: The Stainless Steel Rat Goes to Hell
book.author: Harry Harrison
book.notes: This is getting pretty silly now

book.title: Beyond this Horizon
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: Take itself a bit too seriously, a shadow of where Heinlein would end up.

book.title: Space Cadet
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: He is really hitting his stride. Tight action and a pacey plot

book.title: Red Planet
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: Now we are really cooking. Fast action kids SF, what more is needed.

book.title: The Day After Tomorrow
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: More of the same but with a splash of paranoia, not quite what is needed in an SF action and once again we can see where he is going to end up.

book.title: Farmer in the Sky
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: The 50's really were the golden years. Stick a pin in the list they are all excellently put together.

book.title: Space Family Stone
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: The Wild West in space, you can almost see the covered wagons

book.title: The Man Who Sold the Moon
book.author: Robert Heinlein

book.title: Citizen of the Galaxy
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: This is my favorite of the classic Heinleins

book.title: Starship Troopers
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: I guess I shouldn't like this but I do

book.title: Stranger in a Strange Land
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: Took 3 goes to read, not really finished but I'm not having another go

book.title: The Moon is a Harsh Mistress
book.author: Robert Heinlein
book.notes: To be honest you can stop reading here, it goes pretty quickly downhill from here

book.title: River Town
book.author: Peter Hessler
book.notes: From Sarah, very readable and accessible account of modern China

book.title: Doctor Who and the Masque of Mandragora
book.author: Philpi Hinchcliffe

book.title: Stories not for the Nervious Book One
book.author: Alfred Hitchcock

book.title: In Your Dreams
book.author: Tom Holt
book.notes: Like the first one but the ending was a bit disapointing

book.title: Earth, Air, Fire and Custard
book.author: Tom Holt
book.notes: OK we could have probably done without the second one but this rounds the story off nicely

book.title: How to be Good
book.author: Nick Hornby
book.notes: The jorney is interesting at times but doesn't really go anywhere

book.title: Conan of Cimeria
book.author: Robert E. Howard
book.notes: & de Camp, L. Sprague & Carter, Lin

book.title: Hyperspace
book.author: Michio Kaku
book.notes: What happens when you press the hyperspace button in Asteroids?

book.title: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
book.author: John Le Carre

book.title: The Earthsea Trilogy
book.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
book.notes: Wizard of Earthsea, Tombs of Atuan, Farthest Shore

book.title: The Word for World is Forest
book.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

book.title: The Wind's Twelve Quarters
book.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
book.notes: From Keith, living proof that the catalogue has been used at least once. Borderline excellent but it did cheer me up in San Francisco.

book.title: Always Coming Home
book.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
book.notes: The book equivalent of a concept album

book.title: The Lion, the witch and the Wardrobe
book.author: C. S. Lewis

book.title: The Death of Sleep
book.author: Anne McCaffrey
book.notes: & Jody Lynn Nye, The Planet Pirates II

book.title: Sassinak
book.author: Anne McCaffrey
book.notes: & Elizabeth Moon, The Planet Pirates I

book.title: Partner Ship
book.author: Anne McCaffrey
book.notes: & Margaret Ball, Ship who Sang II

book.title: The Ship who Searched
book.author: Anne McCaffrey
book.notes: & Mercedes Lackey, Ship who Sang III

book.title: Romanitas
book.author: Sophia McDougall
book.notes: Present from Jenny. Seems a bit poderous from the cover but actually reads quite well

book.title: Adolf Hitler, My Part in his Downfall
book.author: Spike Milligan

book.title: The History of the Runestaff
book.author: Michael Moorcock
book.notes: The Jewel in the Skull, The Mad God's Amulet, The Sword of the Dawn and The Runestaff (from Patrick)

book.title: Altered Carbon
book.author: Richard Morgan
book.notes: Best hard SF for a long time

book.title: Market Forces
book.author: Richard Morgan
book.notes: Probably his best book so far, a very thought provoking book that still keeps you guessing until the end

book.title: Woken Furies
book.author: Richard Morgan
book.notes: Better than broken angles but this strand is getting into dimishing returns

book.title: Starter for Ten
book.author: David Nicholls
book.notes: Present from Louise, really captures that complete lack of structure in student life

book.title: The Better World of Reginald Perrin
book.author: David Nobbs

book.title: One for my Baby
book.author: Tony Parsons
book.notes: An enjoyable trip but at times I wasn't actually sure where we were going. This is the same book as Man and Boy with different character names

book.title: Man and Wife
book.author: Tony Parsons
book.notes: Somehow it just should be better, all the ingrediaent are right but something is stll missing

book.title: The Man who Ate the World
book.author: Frederik Pohl

book.title: JEM The Making of a Utopia
book.author: Frederik Pohl

book.title: The Witches Trilogy
book.author: Terry Pratchett
book.notes: Equal Rites, Wyrd Sisters, Witches Abroad

book.title: The Tomorrow People: Three in Three
book.author: Roger Price

book.title: The Tomorrow People: Four into Three
book.author: Roger Price

book.title: The Shipping News
book.author: Annie Proulx
book.notes: A suprisingly warm book given its initial cold outlook

book.title: The Subtle Knife
book.author: Philip Pullman
book.notes: Lucifer was one of the good guys and God has been lying to us ever since!

book.title: Lyra's Oxford
book.author: Philip Pullman
book.notes: Present from Jenny - it is well written and reasonably tense but its a bit of a chapter marooned in nowhere

book.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
book.author: J.K. Rowling
book.notes: Formulaic fun, read A Wizard of Earthsea instead

book.title: Harry Potter and the Chanber of Secrets
book.author: J.K. Rowling

book.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Askaban
book.author: J.K. Rowling
book.notes: Slightly stronger story, but to be honest these are all the same book, mind you its not a bad book

book.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
book.author: J.K. Rowling

book.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Pheonix
book.author: J.K. Rowling

book.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
book.author: J.K. Rowling

book.title: Schott's Original Miscellany
book.author: Ben Schott
book.notes: Where else can you find out which American presidents went to Harvard and which Carry On films starred Hettie Jacques? A present from Cliff and Jo

book.title: The Lovely Bones
book.author: Alice Sebold
book.notes: Strangely uplifting for a book in which the protagonist dies in the first chapter.

book.title: Touching the Void
book.author: Joe Simpson
book.notes: Recommendation from Jo. Read this and you will never complain about having to go upstairs and get something again.

book.title: The Straw Men
book.author: Michael Marshall Smith
book.notes: Cotemporary thriller, and very well done

book.title: Blood of Angles
book.author: Michael Marshall Smith
book.notes: Straw Men 3 - OK enough now, ou probably only really need to read the first book

book.title: What is the Name of this Book?
book.author: Raymond Smullyan

book.title: Zodiac
book.author: Neal Stephenson
book.notes: Takes forever to get going but when it does it is worth it

book.title: The True Game
book.author: Sheri S. Tepper
book.notes: Kings Blood Four, Necromancer Nine and Wizard's Eleven, An engaging idea that probably goes on too long

book.title: The Hobbit
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.notes: I enjoyed this as a child but it does not bear rereading as an adult.

book.title: The Two Towers
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.notes: Lord of the Rings II, the openeing section of this book contains one of my favourite sections.

book.title: The Fellowship of the Ring
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.notes: Lord of the Rings I. I read this at school, it took ages but was worth it.

book.title: The Silmarillion
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.notes: This would make the shit list if I could be bothered finishing it

book.title: The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole aged 13 3/4
book.author: Sue Townsend
book.notes: Amusing start of a dynasty I have no intention of following

book.title: Shibumi
book.author: Trevanian
book.notes: Steph recommended this, reminded me of Our Man Flint

book.title: Weapons of Chaos
book.author: Robert E. Vardeman
book.notes: Echoes of Chaos, Equasions of Chaos and Colors of Chaos

book.title: The Jade Demons Quartet
book.author: Robert E. Vardeman
book.notes: The quaking Lands, The Frozen Waves, The Crystal Clouds and The White Fire

book.title: Journey to the Centre of the Earth
book.author: Jules Verne

book.title: Across Realtime
book.author: Vernon Vinge
book.notes: The Peace War and Marooned in Realtime

book.title: Trainspotting
book.author: Irvine Welsh
book.notes: Frantic, fast paced with a believable ending

book.title: Filth
book.author: Irvine Welsh
book.notes: I was drawn and fascinated as well as repelled by the protagonist

book.title: Porno
book.author: Irvine Welsh
book.notes: The book really tightens up but takes far too long to get going.

book.title: Schrodinger's Cat II: The Trick Top Hat
book.author: Robert Anton Wilson

book.title: One for Sorrow Two for Joy
book.author: Clive Woodall
book.notes: Childish, thin, predictable and unconvincing. Do not believe the cover when it refers to Lord of the rings et al.

book.title: The Doors of his Face, The lamps of his Mouth
book.author: Roger Zelazny
